intro: Phorolobus acrostichoides, commonly known as the broadleaf fern, is a tropical plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Polypodiaceae and is characterized by its large, leathery, evergreen leaves. The plant typically grows as an epiphyte or on rocky surfaces, thriving in humid, shaded environments. Its fronds are divided into numerous pinnae, creating a feathery appearance. It plays a significant role in the ecological balance of its habitat by providing shelter and food for various microorganisms and small animals.
